unnormalised: A recent study published in "The Lancet Oncology" highlights a concerning rise in early-onset cancer cases in metros like Delhi & Mumbai. Dr. R.K. Sharma, Head of Oncology at AIIMS, attributes this trend to various factors, including lifestyle changes and environmental pollution. The study, conducted over a period of 5 yrs, examined over 10,000 patients.
normalised: A recent study published in "The Lancet Oncology" highlights a concerning rise in early-onset cancer cases in metros like Delhi and Mumbai. Doctor R. K. Sharma, Head of Oncology at A-I-I-M-S, attributes this trend to various factors, including lifestyle changes and environmental pollution. The study, conducted over a period of five years, examined over ten thousand patients.

unnormalised: One of the key findings was the increasing prevalence of breast cancer in women under 40 yrs of age. Previously, the avg age for diagnosis was 55 yrs. Researchers observed that approximately 25% of new breast cancer cases now involve younger women, posing significant challenges for treatment & survival rates.
normalised: One of the key findings was the increasing prevalence of breast cancer in women under forty years of age. Previously, the average age for diagnosis was fifty five years. Researchers observed that approximately twenty five percent of new breast cancer cases now involve younger women, posing significant challenges for treatment and survival rates.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the study indicated a surge in lung cancer among non-smokers, especially in areas with high levels of air pollution. In Delhi-NCR, for instance, the number of such cases has risen by almost 15% in the last 3 yrs. The study also noted the effectiveness of new therapies like Immunotherapy in certain advanced stage cases, with a success rate of roughly 60%.
normalised: Furthermore, the study indicated a surge in lung cancer among non-smokers, especially in areas with high levels of air pollution. In Delhi-N-C-R, for instance, the number of such cases has risen by almost fifteen percent in the last three years. The study also noted the effectiveness of new therapies like Immunotherapy in certain advanced stage cases, with a success rate of roughly sixty percent.

unnormalised: These findings underscore the urgent need for increased awareness, regular screenings, and preventive measures to combat the growing burden of cancer in India. Early detection remains crucial, and Dr. Sharma urges individuals to consult a physician for any unusual symptoms without delay. He added that AIIMS will be hosting a free cancer screening camp on 10/11/2024.
normalised: These findings underscore the urgent need for increased awareness, regular screenings, and preventive measures to combat the growing burden of cancer in India. Early detection remains crucial, and Doctor Sharma urges individuals to consult a physician for any unusual symptoms without delay. He added that A-I-I-M-S will be hosting a free cancer screening camp on tenth November two thousand and twenty four.
